node.statement: By definition of Stirling-second-kind (def:Stirling-second-kind), S(n,k) counts the number of partitions of an n-element set into exactly k non-empty blocks. By definition of Bell-number (def:Bell-number), B_n counts the total number of partitions of an n-element set. By definition of partition (def:partition), every partition of [n] has some number of non-empty blocks k where 0 <= k <= n. The partitions are classified by their block count k, yielding a disjoint union. Since these sets are pairwise disjoint and their union covers all partitions, we have B_n = sum_{k=0}^{n} S(n,k) by the addition principle for disjoint sets.
